issue.title: Splitwise Clone v2
issue.body:
## Build expense-sharing app

A web app where friends track shared expenses and settle debts.

**Features:**
- Google OAuth + email/password login  
- Create expense groups, invite members
- Add expenses (split equally among members)
- Real-time balance calculations
- Settle up functionality
- Live updates with Socket.io

**Tech Stack:**
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
- Lucide React icons
- SQLite with better-sqlite3
- NextAuth.js
- Socket.io

**Design:**
- Clean, minimal - not generic AI look
- Mobile-first responsive
- Use shadcn/ui components

**Pages:**
- Landing page
- Login/Signup
- Dashboard (list groups, balances)
- Group detail (expenses, members, balances)
- Create group dialog

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router, configure TypeScript, create .gitignore for Next.js, set up package.json with all dependencies (next-auth, better-sqlite3, socket.io, shadcn/ui, tailwindcss), configure tsconfig.json with strict mode, and set up Tailwind CSS configuration

workers.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project structure, configure package.json with dependencies (next, next-auth, better-sqlite3, socket.io, react, react-dom, typescript, @types/node, @types/react, @types/react-dom, tailwindcss, postcss, autoprefixer, lucide-react, clsx, tailwind-merge), create TypeScript configuration files, and set up .gitignore for Next.js
Configure Tailwind CSS with custom theme, create global CSS file with Tailwind directives, set up lib utilities for cn() function, and create base app directory structure with layout and page files
Set up Next.js App Router directory structure with route folders, create environment variables template (.env.example), and initialize component utilities directory with shadcn/ui helper files

ems.task: Design and implement SQLite database schema with better-sqlite3, including tables for users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, and settlements. Create database initialization and connection utilities. Implement all database access layer functions for CRUD operations

workers.task: Create database schema initialization and connection utilities. Create lib/db/schema.ts with table definitions (users, groups, group_members, expenses, expense_splits, settlements) and lib/db/index.ts for database connection and initialization logic.

Implement all user and group-related CRUD operations. Create lib/db/users.ts (createUser, getUserByEmail, getUserById) and lib/db/groups.ts (createGroup, getGroupById, getGroupsByUserId, updateGroup, deleteGroup).

Implement all expense, expense split, and settlement CRUD operations. Create lib/db/expenses.ts (createExpense, getExpensesByGroupId, updateExpense, deleteExpense), lib/db/expense-splits.ts (createExpenseSplit, getExpenseSplitsByExpenseId, getExpenseSplitsByGroupId, getBalancesForGroup), and lib/db/settlements.ts (createSettlement, getSettlementsByGroupId, getPendingSettlementsByUserId, markSettlementAsPaid).

ems.task: Configure NextAuth.js for authentication with both Google OAuth provider and email/password credentials. Implement session management, API routes for login/signup/logout, and protected route middleware. Create user registration and profile management

workers.task: Create core authentication types and interfaces in src/types/auth.ts. Define User, Session, Account, and Verification token types for the entire auth system.

Configure NextAuth.js with Google OAuth and Credentials provider in src/lib/auth.ts. Implement auth options, session strategy, and adapter configuration. Create auth configuration file at src/auth.config.ts with environment variables setup.

Implement authentication API routes for login, signup, and logout operations. Create API handlers at src/app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts, src/app/api/auth/signup/route.ts, and src/app/api/auth/logout/route.ts. Create user registration service in src/lib/services/user-registration.ts.

ems.task: Implement group management functionality including creating groups, inviting members via email/invite codes, joining groups, and managing member roles. Build the balance calculation engine that tracks who owes whom. Create settlement logic for marking debts as paid
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Build expense management features: add expenses with description, amount, payer, and split configuration. Implement equal split logic among group members. Create expense editing and deletion. Build expense history and filtering capabilities

workers.task: Create expense data models and types. Define expense entities, split configuration types, and filter types in src/features/expenses/types.ts
Implement core expense operations: add, edit, delete expenses with equal split logic in src/features/expenses/expense-service.ts
Build expense history, filtering capabilities, and query functions in src/features/expenses/expense-history.ts

ems.task: Implement Socket.io server for real-time updates. Create events for new expenses, group changes, member joins/leaves, and settlements. Build presence system for active users. Handle connection/disconnection and room management per group

Build landing page with hero section and feature highlights. Create login and signup pages with forms for both OAuth and email/password. Implement form validation and error handling. Add responsive navigation and footer components

Implement dashboard page showing user's groups with net balance per group, total owed/owing summary, and quick actions to create groups or settle up. Build responsive grid layout for group cards with balance indicators and member avatars

Create group detail page with expense list, member list showing individual balances, add expense form, and settle up functionality. Build expense modal dialog with split configuration. Implement member management (invite/remove). Add activity feed for recent changes

Create reusable shadcn/ui components customized for the app: buttons, cards, dialogs, forms, tables, avatars, badges, and toast notifications. Implement consistent design tokens, color scheme, and typography. Add loading states and skeleton screens

Implement Socket.io client integration for real-time UI updates. Connect to dashboard, group detail pages for live expense/balance changes. Build optimistic UI updates for better perceived performance. Handle connection errors and reconnection logic

analysisSummary: Build a complete expense-sharing application with Next.js 14, featuring Google OAuth/email authentication, group expense management, real-time balance tracking, and Socket.io for live updates. The app will use SQLite for data storage, shadcn/ui for the UI, and implement a clean, mobile-first design.
